means: 呈现，出现，发生( arise的过去式 )

sentence.Network_en: Heavy Metal music really arose in the late 60s.
sentence.Network_cn: 重金属音乐真正形成于60年代后期。

sentence.Network_en: Another flight would be arranged on Saturday if sufficient demand arose.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果需求量足够大，周六将再安排一趟航班。

sentence.Network_en: As soon as the tremor passed, many people spontaneously arose and cheered.
sentence.Network_cn: 震感刚一过去，很多人就自发地站起来欢呼。

PerfectNetExp.abs: aromatize vt 使芳香arose 引发around the corner 在拐角处
initiate 引起，引发arose 引发, 唤起trigger 引起, 引发, 扳机tiger
Before they could start , a mist arose ., 在他们动身前 , 一阵雾兴起了.
the peasants arose against their masters ., 农民奋起反对奴役他们的人.

list.abs: the confusion about the date of the meeting arose from a typing error .关于会期的混淆起因于一个打字错误。
the submarine issue arose in such a way as to confuse the American people and their leaders .潜艇问题出现的方式，使美国人民及其领袖感到慌乱。
When the storm arose , the wind chopped around and the little boat almost sank ., 风暴骤起时风向改变了 , 小船差点给弄沉了.
Owen paused and immediately there arose a great clamour from his listeners ., 欧文停了下来 , 听众中立即掀起一阵喧嚣.

entry.def: Arose is the past tense of arise.

auth_sentence.content: The social magma that arose out of this dissolution.
auth_sentence.res_content: The social magma that arose out of this dissolution.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The social magma that arose out of this dissolution.

auth_sentence.content: Experts believe pollen-dependent bees arose from carnivorous wasp ancestors.
auth_sentence.res_content: Experts believe pollen-dependent bees arose from carnivorous wasp ancestors.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Experts believe pollen-dependent bees arose from carnivorous wasp ancestors.

auth_sentence.content: Consciousness first arose when deaf and blind first interbred.
auth_sentence.res_content: Consciousness first arose when deaf and blind first interbred.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Consciousness first arose when deaf and blind first interbred.
